Chapter 6 Antigone, Part III: Realizations 1. The word used by Teiresias is nosei (malady, illness), which some translate as plague (usually miasma – as Creon will say in 1042–4, though in order to deny it). Yet Teiresias’ description is not one of a general plague like in Oedipus Tyrannos, but rather one of impurity and desecration, which is why I prefer to render it as a “defilement” affecting the city’s altars and communication with the gods
